question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/liquidity_math.move] [Function: get_liquidity_for_amount_x()] [Roundtrip Inconsistency] If get_liquidity_for_amount_x(amount_x) → liquidity, then get_amount_x_for_liquidity(liquidity) doesn't return amount_x due to rounding, can repeated conversions extract value? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/liquidity_math.move] [Function: get_liquidity_for_amount_x()] [Max Amount Input] When amount_x=u64::max, will multiplication in get_liquidity_for_amount_x() overflow u128, causing incorrect liquidity calculation or abort? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/liquidity_math.move] [Function: get_liquidity_for_amount_x()] [Identical Sqrt Prices] If sqrt_price_current == sqrt_price_target, will get_liquidity_for_amount_x() divide by zero or return infinity, causing vault operations to abort? (High)

(Critical)

(Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/liquidity_math.move] [Function: get_liquidity_for_amount_y()] [Division by Small Delta] When sqrt_price_current and sqrt_price_target are very close, will division by small delta cause liquidity to inflate to massive values, allowing share minting with minimal collateral? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/liquidity_math.move] [Function: get_liquidity_for_amount_y()] [Roundtrip Inconsistency] If get_liquidity_for_amount_y(amount_y) → liquidity, then get_amount_y_for_liquidity(liquidity) returns different amount_y, can this be exploited through repeated deposits/withdrawals? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/liquidity_math.move] [Function: get_liquidity_for_amount_y()] [Identical Sqrt Prices] If sqrt_price_current == sqrt_price_target, will get_liquidity_for_amount_y() divide by zero or return infinity, breaking vault operations? (Medium)
